pullRequest.title: Handle Routes as objects

nodes.bodyText: If we have complex and well defined equals of CloudRouteSummary, it could be possible to use native set addAll()
Is that a leftover?
Can we make it on one line
Why this is called TestDataUtil but file TestData.java
The class also has toString()

It is ok to send null or empty since it is not used.
Probably this was the reason for passing null before.
Use directly Set.of()

I think context should be renamed to routesElement because this is a private function dedicated only for this use case where we pass route entry and routesElement. However, this is my personal perception becai
If it is not too mu effort remove theses internal entities like sofd60245639a and i users
can you add some short description for each test
getUriParametersParser should be renamed to routeParameterParser
I think now this class should be renamed to RouteParameterParser
You can add that set of assembled routes is returned
Rename uris to routes
Is it exist case when passed argument will be null?
Did we previously support routes with port in CF?
I think this method should be use private access modifier
Is it used the right code formatter for this class?
You can use Map.of instead of new HashMap() {}
So we cannot keep only one TestData class in util or process package?
You can use Map.of with short if statement
we should delete this user from all tests
I am not sure is it okay to use such domain in our tests
I am not sure is it okay to use this as test domain in OSS
I didn't see where is used java.util.stream.Collectors and StringUtils imports
CloudRouteSummary as far as I remember it has toString() imeplemented. So you can just pass the object itself and it will be printed
Previously this will result in List with duplicated old elements in result list, is it right?
There is some issue with spaces, maybe there is tabs instead of spaces
Don't forget before merge of this PR to make release of multiapps and cloudfoundry-client projects.

nodes.bodyText: Rename IdleUriParametersParser to IdleRouteParametersParser
If you don't add entries in the map after that, you can return Collections.emptyMap()

commit.message: routes are no longer handled as strings
